normalised: Namaste folks! Big news on the renewable energy front – things are heating up, in a good way! Doctor Sharma at I I T-Bombay just announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency. Apparently, they've managed to boost output by a whopping fifteen percent!

unnormalised: Namaste folks! Big news on the renewable energy front – things are heating up, in a good way! Dr. Sharma at IIT-Bombay just announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency. Apparently, they've managed to boost output by a whopping 15%!
normalised: Meanwhile, Rajasthan is going full steam ahead with a massive new wind farm project near Jaisalmer. We're talking about a facility spread across thousands of acres, potentially powering millions of homes. The initial investment is estimated at a cool rupee five thousand crore!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Rajasthan is going full steam ahead with a massive new wind farm project near Jaisalmer. We're talking about a facility spread across thousands of acres, potentially powering millions of homes. The initial investment is estimated at a cool Rs. 5000 crores!
normalised: But it's not just the big boys; local communities are also getting involved. In a small village near Pune, they've installed solar panels on the panchayat building, saving them a bundle on electricity bills. Plus, a group of students from Delhi University are working on a project to build low-cost solar water heaters using recycled materials – pretty impressive! Imagine the impact if every rooftop had solar panels, from Kashmir to Kanyakumari! A single house in Mumbai might save approximately two thousand square feet of carbon footprint over its lifetime with renewable energy. This feels like a real Swachh Bharat for our power grid!
